definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
bright star/name of North Korean space satellite
(neologism c. 2014) celebrity with a huge, devoted fan base/celebrity with a huge following on social media

sentences.english: There is no doubt he is the "Rock Star" CEO.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，他就是傳說中的“搖滾明星式”CEO。

sentences.english: A gaggle of schoolgirls followed the tennis star to his car.
sentences.chinese: 一羣嘰哩呱啦的女學生跟著網球明星到他的車子。

sentences.english: The actress is dressed by the best-known designer in Paris.
sentences.chinese: 這位女明星的衣服是由巴黎最知名的設計師提供的。

sentences.english: Bacon still remains one of the top movie stars in Hollywood.
sentences.chinese: 而貝肯仍舊是好萊塢數一數二的電影明星。

sentences.english: With the same as Hollywood, the star is the important insurance ofthe Hong Kong movie booking office.
sentences.chinese: 與好萊圬一樣，明星是香港電影票房的重要保證。

sentences.english: Crowning "stars" among literary upstarts is killing them.
sentences.chinese: 把所謂“明星”捧做文唐袈貴即是抹殺他們。

sentences.english: The old basketball star walks gingerly on aching knees.
sentences.chinese: 年邁的籃球明星會因膝蓋的傷痛步履蹣跚。

sentences.english: Only rock stars are allowed to wear leather pants. 12.
sentences.chinese: 只有搖滾明星才允許穿皮褲。
那位電影明星紅得發紫。

sentences.english: Now she is named as the Top Ten Star of 2010 by Top Hits.
sentences.chinese: 現在，她被命名爲2010年十大明星的熱門點擊。

sentences.english: Peter: Many of these stars have joined foreign nationalities.
sentences.chinese: 很多明星都已經加入了外國籍了。

sentences.english: The journalists like to dish the dirt about television stars.
sentences.chinese: 記者有時喜歡揭電視明星的瘡疤。

sentences.english: The star boozed frequently in his younger days.
sentences.chinese: 該明星在年輕時經常酗酒。

sentences.english: The former football star is expected to return to his Florida home.
sentences.chinese: 這名前足球明星想返回弗羅裏達家中。

sentences.english: Many actress love the see-through blouses very much.
sentences.chinese: 很多女明星對透視裝鍾愛有加。

sentences.english: The young movie star revelled in the public's admiration.
sentences.chinese: 這位年輕的電影明星沉湎於觀衆的讚美聲中。

definition: currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
(neologism c. 2014) celebrity with a huge, devoted fan base/celebrity with a huge following on social media
bean vermicelli/mung bean starch noodles/Chinese vermicelli/cellophane noodles/CL:把[ba3]/fan (loanword)/enthusiast for sb or sth
